original: 1.2 Your employment shall commence on 26  September 2019 and shall continue unless and until either party gives notice to the other in accordance with paragraph 11 below. No employment with a previous employer is deemed to be continuous with your employment with the Company.
ollama_generated: 1.2 Your employment by the Company begins on September 26, 2019, and shall persist unless either party chooses, at their discretion and in accordance with paragraph 11 below, to terminate this agreement. It is understood that any prior employment does not constitute a continuation of your employment with the Company. The Company reserves the right to terminate your employment without cause or notice.

original: 4.3 For the purposes of this Agreement your earned salary shall mean the proportion of your Salary earned by and due to you in each calendar year of employment with the Company (“ Earned Salary ”).
ollama_generated: 4.3 In the context of this Agreement, the term "Earned Salary" refers to the portion of your total annual compensation that is accumulated and payable to you over the course of each calendar year during your employment with the Company ("Accrued Salary"). However, it's important to note that the Company retains discretion over the actual payment schedule, which may not align exactly with the annual calendar year.

original: 4.4 Annual Performance Bonuses:
ollama_generated:
4.4 Potential Performance Incentives:

In the event that the Company achieves certain predetermined performance benchmarks in a given calendar year, you may become eligible for discretionary incentive payments at the sole and absolute discretion of the Company's Board of Directors, subject to any applicable laws and policies. The specific amount and terms of such incentives shall be determined by the Board of Directors, if any, and no obligation or commitment is implied on the part of the Company to award such incentives in any given year.

original: Any Annual Performance Bonus paid will not be pensionable and are subject to statutory applicable tax and National Insurance deductions. Performance will be assessed by the Compensation Committee at the end of each calendar year, against annual corporate and personal performance objectives agreed between you and the Board at the start of each calendar year, with any such bonus being payable in the first quarter of the following year. Qualification for your Annual Performance Bonus will require that you are employed by the Company (and have not served notice of termination of your employment to the Company) on 31 December of the year to which your bonus entitlement applies.
ollama_generated: Any Annual Performance Bonus awarded shall not be considered for pension purposes and will be subject to applicable statutory tax and National Insurance deductions. The determination of your annual performance will be made by the Compensation Committee at the conclusion of each calendar year, based on agreed annual corporate and personal performance objectives, which were established between you and the Board at the commencement of the year. The eligibility for your Annual Performance Bonus is contingent upon your continued employment with the Company up until 31st December of the year that the bonus pertains to. In the event that notice of termination of employment has been given by you to the Company prior to this date, you will no longer be eligible for the Annual Performance Bonus for that specific year.

original: 5.4 Further details regarding benefits will be provided upon commencement of your employment. The Company reserves the right to replace or supplement any or all of the scheme(s) referred to in this paragraph 5, or to amend them at any time without compensation, provided that equivalent scheme(s) providing a similar level of benefit are put in place.
ollama_generated: 5.4 Detailed information about the benefits offered will be shared post-employment commencement. The Employee acknowledges and agrees that the Company maintains the discretion to revise, modify, or discontinue any scheme(s) mentioned within this Section 5, or introduce new ones, at any given moment without prior notice or compensation. However, should such changes occur, the Company ensures a reasonable effort will be made to establish comparable benefits under alternative schemes offering an equivalent level of advantage.

original: 6 EXPENSES The Company shall reimburse all reasonable out of pocket expenses properly incurred by you in the performance of the duties under this Agreement including travelling, subsistence and entertainment expenses provided you follow the Company’s guidelines/allowances in force at the relevant time and provided that you shall, where reasonably practicable, provide the Company with vouchers, invoices or such other evidence of such expenses as the Company may reasonably require.
ollama_generated: 6 REIMBURSEMENT OF EXPENSES: The Employee is entitled to claim reimbursement for all necessary and reasonable out-of-pocket expenses incurred during the fulfillment of duties outlined in this Agreement, encompassing travel, sustenance, and entertainment expenses. However, this entitlement is contingent upon the employee adhering to the Company's guidelines or allowances effective at the relevant time. The employee shall, whenever possible, submit vouchers, invoices, or other evidence of such expenses as reasonably requested by the Company to substantiate the claim for reimbursement. It should be noted that the Company reserves the right to withhold reimbursement if the employee's expense report is not provided in a timely and satisfactory manner.

original: 7 HOURS OF WORK 7.1 Your normal working hours are Monday to Friday from 9.00 am to 5.30 pm on each working day with one hour for lunch. You will be required to work such other hours as shall be reasonably necessary for you to perform your duties for which no further remuneration is payable.
ollama_generated:
7 HOURS OF WORK

7.1 Your regular working hours are Monday to Friday, from 9.00 am to 5.30 pm, with an hour allocated for lunch. However, it may become necessary for you to work additional hours, which will be determined on a case-by-case basis and will not incur any extra compensation. This is intended to ensure the completion of your assigned tasks effectively and efficiently.

original: 8 HOLIDAYS 8.1 In addition to the usual public holidays you will be entitled to 25 working days paid holiday in each calendar year. The holiday will accrue on a pro rata basis throughout each calendar year.
ollama_generated:
8. ANNUAL LEAVE
8.1 Beyond the customary public holidays, your entitlement extends to 25 working days of uninterrupted leave within each calendar year. The accumulation of this leave will be calculated proportionately across each calendar year.

However, please note that the Company reserves the right to require that you take any portion of your annual leave during specified periods in order to ensure efficient operation of our services. Any changes to your planned leave schedule shall be subject to prior approval by the management team.

original: 8.2 Holidays may only be taken at such time or times as are approved beforehand by the CEO, such approval not to be unreasonably withheld or delayed. You must give reasonable notice of proposed holiday dates by e-mailing the CEO or delegated director in advance, for approval.
ollama_generated: 8.2 Employees are encouraged to take their holidays at a mutually convenient time for both the employee and the CEO, with the understanding that any delay in approval will be kept to an absolute minimum. It is expected that employees provide ample notice of their proposed holiday dates, but it should be noted that the CEO or delegated director reserves the right to approve or deny requests, provided such decisions are made reasonably.

original: 8.5 In the event that notice of termination of this Agreement is served by either party, the Company may require you to take any outstanding holiday during this notice period.
ollama_generated: 8.5 Upon receipt of a notice of termination from either party, your obligation to utilize any accrued but unused vacation days during the notice period shall be at the discretion of the Company, with such requirement being optional rather than mandatory. However, should the Company choose to exercise this option, your cooperation is expected in complying with the request in a timely manner and without undue inconvenience.

original: 9.5 The payment of sick pay in accordance with this paragraph 9 is without prejudice to the Company’s right to terminate this Agreement prior to the expiry of your right to payments.
ollama_generated: 9.5 The provision of sick pay, as outlined in this paragraph 9, does not impact the Employee's right to receive payments up until the termination of this Agreement, which remains at the sole discretion of the Company, regardless of any previously stipulated timelines for payment.

original: 10.2 During any such period as described in paragraph 10.1 (“ Garden Leave ”) the Company may appoint another person to carry out some or all of your duties. You will continue to owe all other duties and obligations (whether express or implied including fidelity and good faith) during Garden Leave and you shall continue to receive full pay and benefits (except that you will not accrue any further entitlement to any cash or equity incentive awards or bonus payments in respect of the Garden Leave period).
ollama_generated: 10.2 In the event described under paragraph 10.1 ("Garden Leave"), you shall have no right to perform any duties during this period, and the Company reserves the option to assign another individual to fulfil your former duties, in whole or in part. During Garden Leave, you will remain bound by all other obligations (whether expressly stated or implied), including loyalty and faithfulness, but your compensation and benefits shall continue at their current levels. However, no additional cash or equity incentive awards, nor any bonus payments for the Garden Leave period, will be accrued. Instead, any previously accrued, but unpaid, cash or equity incentive awards may become due and payable upon termination of your employment.

original: 10.6 During any period of Garden Leave the Company may require you to take any outstanding holiday entitlement.
ollama_generated:
10.6 During any duration of Garden Leave, you are obliged to utilize, at the discretion of the Company, any accumulated but unutilized vacation time.

Here's another option with a slight shift in responsibility:

10.6 During any period of Garden Leave, it is your responsibility to either exhaust or request approval for any unused holiday entitlement within the Company's discretion.

original: 11.6 If your employment with the Company is terminated for any reason, the Company shall pay or provide to you (or to your authorised representative or estate) (i) any Salary earned through the Termination Date (as defined below); (ii) unpaid expense reimbursements (subject to, and in accordance with, paragraph 6 of this Agreement); and (iii) any vested benefits you may have under any employee benefit plan of the Company through the Termination Date, which vested benefits shall be paid and/or provided in accordance with the terms of such employee benefit plans (collectively, the “Accrued Benefits ”).
ollama_generated: 11.6 Upon termination of your employment with the Company, for any reason, it will be the employee's responsibility to initiate a claim for payment of accrued wages up to and including the Termination Date (as defined below), unpaid expense reimbursements (in accordance with paragraph 6 of this Agreement), and any vested benefits under any employee benefit plan of the Company up to the Termination Date. The Company shall process these claims within a reasonable timeframe, subject to the terms and conditions of the relevant employee benefit plans (collectively referred to as the "Accrued Benefits"). It is the employee's responsibility to provide proper authorization for any representative or estate to receive such Accrued Benefits.

original: (i) the Company shall pay you (or your authorised representative or estate if the termination is due to your death) an amount equal to the sum of (A) your annual salary as of the Termination Date (or your annual salary in effect immediately prior to the Change in Control, if higher) plus (B) your target annual performance bonus amount under the Annual Bonus Plan for the then-current year (the “ Change in Control Payment ”), which payment shall not be reduced by either the value of any salary paid to you during your notice period or by the value of any payment made to you in lieu of notice pursuant to paragraph 11.2; (ii) the Company shall: pay you (or your authorised representative or estate if the termination is due to your death) an amount equal to the cost to the Company of providing you with the contractual benefits under paragraph 5 for twelve (12) months or, at the Company’s option, continue to provide you with such benefits for twelve (12) months; and (iii) notwithstanding anything to the contrary in any applicable option agreement or other stock-based award agreement, all Time-Based Equity Awards shall immediately accelerate and become fully exercisable (for a period determined in accordance with the rules of the applicable equity plan) or nonforfeitable as of the later of (A) the Termination Date or (B) the Accelerated Vesting Date; provided  that any termination or forfeiture of the unvested portion of such Time-Based Equity Awards that would otherwise occur on the Termination Date in the absence of this Agreement will be delayed until the Effective Date of the Settlement Agreements and will only occur if the vesting pursuant to this subsection does not occur due to the absence of the Settlement Agreements becoming fully effective within the time period set forth therein. Notwithstanding the foregoing, no additional vesting of the Time-Based Equity Awards shall occur during the period between your Termination Date and the Accelerated Vesting Date.
ollama_generated:
1. Upon termination, whether due to your death or voluntary resignation, you (or your designated representative) will be entitled to receive the following: (i) a payment equivalent to your annual salary as of the Termination Date (or your annual salary in effect immediately preceding a Change in Control, if higher), plus (ii) your target annual performance bonus amount under the Annual Bonus Plan for the then-current year (hereinafter referred to as "Change in Control Payment"). This payment will not be subject to reduction based on any salary or notice period payments received by you, nor any payment made in lieu of notice.

2. Upon termination, the Company shall provide one of two options: (i) pay you (or your designated representative) an amount equivalent to the cost of providing contractual benefits under paragraph 5 for a period of twelve (12) months, or (ii) continue to provide these benefits for a period of twelve (12) months. The Company's decision in this matter is at its sole discretion.

3. In contrast to any provisions in applicable option agreements or other stock-based award agreements, all Time-Based Equity Awards will become immediately vestable (for a duration determined by the applicable equity plan rules) or non-forfeitable as of the later of (A) the Termination Date or (B) the Accelerated Vesting Date. However, any unvested portion of these awards that would otherwise terminate upon your termination will instead vest on the Effective Date of the Settlement Agreements. If the vesting under this subsection is not achieved due to the Settlement Agreements not becoming effective within the specified timeframe, then and only then will forfeiture of the unvested portion occur. During the period between your Termination Date and the Accelerated Vesting Date, no additional vesting of Time-Based Equity Awards will take place.

4. Notwithstanding the preceding provisions, no additional vesting of Time-Based Equity Awards will occur during the time between your termination date and the accelerated vesting date.

original: (a) disclose or use for your own or for another’s purpose or benefit any Confidential Information which you may learn while in the employment of the Company except as required by a court of law or any regulatory body or that which may be in or become part of the public domain other than through any act or default on your part; (b) copy or reproduce in any form or by or on any media or device or allow others access to copy or reproduce any documents (including without limitation letters, facsimiles and memoranda), disks, memory devices, notebooks, tapes or other medium whether or not eye-readable and copies thereof on which Confidential Information may from time to time be recorded or referred to (“ Documents ”); or (c) remove or transmit from the Company or any Group Company’s premises any Documents on which Confidential information may from time to time be recorded.

13.4 Upon termination of your employment for any reason by either party, you must immediately return to the Company all Company property including but not limited to documents, papers, records, keys, credit cards, mobile telephones, computer and related equipment, PDA or similar device, security passes, accounts, specifications, drawings, lists, correspondence, catalogues or the like relating to the Company’s business which is in your possession or under your control and you must not take copies of the same without the Company’s express written authority.
ollama_generated: 13.4 Upon the termination of your employment, regardless of the cause by either party, it is expected that all property belonging to the Company will be returned promptly. This encompasses documents, papers, records, keys, credit cards, mobile devices, computer equipment and related items, security passes, accounts, specifications, drawings, lists, correspondence, catalogues or similar materials pertaining to the Company's business that are currently in your custody or under your control. Under no circumstances should you make copies of such materials without the Company's explicit, written consent.

original: 14.3 While the restrictions set out in paragraph 14.2 above are considered by the parties to be reasonable in all the circumstances, it is agreed that if any one or more of such restrictions shall either taken by itself or themselves together be adjudged to go beyond what is reasonable in all the circumstances for the protection of the legitimate interests of the Company but would be adjudged reasonable if any particular restriction or restrictions were deleted or if any part or parts of the wording thereof were deleted, restricted or limited in a particular manner, then the restrictions set out in paragraph 14.2 above shall apply with such deletions or restrictions or limitations as the case may be.
ollama_generated:
14.3 The restrictions detailed in paragraph 14.2 are deemed reasonable under the circumstances by both parties; however, should a court determine that any one or more of these restrictions, when viewed individually or collectively, exceed what is considered reasonable for safeguarding the Company's legitimate interests, then the following shall apply:

The restrictions detailed in paragraph 14.2 will remain effective, but with such deletions, restrictions, or limitations as necessary to render them reasonable, as determined by the court. This means that while the original restrictions might be considered excessive, they can be adjusted or modified to an extent deemed acceptable by a competent judicial authority. The onus of determining these adjustments falls upon the court.

original: 15.4 All IPRs subsisting in any Works shall be the exclusive property of the Company.
modified: 15.4 The ownership of all Intellectual Property Rights (IPRs) pertaining to any Works shall be jointly owned by both Parties, with the primary responsibility for exploitation and commercialization lying with the Company. The other Party retains a non-exclusive, royalty-free license to use the Works for their internal purposes.

original: 15.6 To the extent permitted by law you hereby irrevocably and unconditionally waive in favour of the Company, its licensees and successors in title, all existing and future Moral Rights (or similar rights existing in any part of the world) you may have in respect of any Works under Chapter IV of the Copyright Designs and Patents Act 1988 in England or any similar provisions of law in any jurisdiction, including (but without limitation) the right to be identified, the right of integrity and the right against false attribution, and agrees not to institute, support, maintain or permit any action or claim to the effect that any treatment, exploitation or use of such Works, Inventions or other materials infringes the Consultant's Moral Rights.
ollama_generated: 15.6 Granted by you and binding upon the Company, its licensees, and successors in title, this agreement waives any and all rights (or their equivalents worldwide) that you may hold under Chapter IV of the Copyright Designs and Patents Act 1988 in England or comparable provisions in any jurisdiction, concerning Works as defined by Section 77-79 CDPA. This waiver includes but is not limited to the rights to attribution, integrity, and protection from misattribution, and you undertake not to initiate, back or sustain any action or claim that the Company's treatment, exploitation, or use of such Works, Inventions, or materials violates your Moral Rights. Instead, you agree to permit and support the Company's actions consistent with this clause.

original: 15.8 You shall keep details of all Inventions confidential and shall not disclose the subject matter of any Inventions to any person outside the Company without the prior consent of the Company. You acknowledge that any unauthorised disclosure of such subject matter may prevent the Company from obtaining patent or registered intellectual property protection for such Invention.
ollama_generated: 15.8 The Company retains sole discretion to determine whether to share details of all Inventions with third parties. Should it elect not to do so, you are prohibited from disclosing any such confidential information about the Inventions to any person or entity without our prior written approval. It is understood that unauthorized disclosure may compromise the Company's ability to secure patent or registered intellectual property protection for these Inventions.

original: 17 COLLECTIVE AGREEMENTS There are no collective agreements which directly affect your terms and conditions of employment.
ollama_generated: 17 COLLECTIVE AGREEMENTS: No existing collective agreements shall be construed as having a direct impact on your employment terms and conditions, leaving room for potential future adjustments that may be favorable to you.

original: Depending on context, you may then need to provide further information on the circumstances of the breach.
ollama_generated: In certain situations, it shall be at your discretion not to disclose any additional details regarding the alleged breach, unless explicitly requested by us in writing. However, we reserve the right to request such information at our convenience, should we deem it necessary for a thorough investigation.

original: 18.7 Failure to notify a breach or to provide information as set out above will be treated seriously and disciplinary action may be taken.
modified: 18.7 It is acknowledged that non-compliance with the requirements specified earlier, including failing to report breaches or withholding requested information, shall be regarded with leniency, but it is at our discretion to impose corrective measures, should such actions deem necessary.

original: “Group Company ” means a subsidiary or affiliate and any other company which is for the time being a holding company of the Company or another subsidiary or affiliate of any such holding company as defined by the Companies Act 2006 (as amended) and “ Group Companies ” will be interpreted accordingly.
ollama_generated: "Group Company" shall encompass any entity that, at a given moment, is controlled by the Company, directly or indirectly through a subsidiary or affiliate, or is itself a holding company of such subsidiary or affiliate, as defined under the Companies Act 2006 (as amended). The term "Group Companies" shall also be construed in this broad manner.

original: Executed as a Deed by NIGEL CROCKETT:

Executed as a Deed by NIGEL CROCKETT:
